page.title: 06FISHING DOWNDERRY
page.content: THERE IS A LONG HISTORY OF FISHING FROM THE MAIN DOWNDERRY BEACH.SINCE THE END OF THE LAST CENTURY COMMERCIAL FISHERY HAS DIMINISHED AND SPORT FISHERY INCREASED.PRESENTLY THERE ARE 3 FULL TIME AND 6 PART TIME FISHERMAN WORKING FROM THE BEACH;A RECENT INCREASE REFLECTIMG DIFFICULTIES IN ALTERNATIVE EMPLOYMENT. THE MOST IMPORTANT CATCH IS LOBSTER WHICH WITH EDIBLE CRAB AND SPIDER CRAB ARE CAUGHT IN SUBMERGED TRAPS.THE DESIGN OF THESE CRABPOTS IS VARIED AND STILL CHANGING. TRADITIONALY THEY WERE MADE FROM WOVEN TWIGS LIKE A WICKER BASKET WITH A PROTECTED ENTRANCE.SUITABLE WILLOW WAS GROWN NEARBY.NOW A VARIOUS MATERIALS INCLUDING POLYPROPYLENE NETTING AND ALKATHENE PIPE ARE USED TO FORM SIMILAR TRAPS.THE SHELLFISH ARE ATTRACTED BY BAITS OF FISH DEBRIS TIED INSIDE THE WEIGHTED POTS
